item.title: Eiffel Tower evacuated after man climbs up ahead of Paris Olympics closing ceremony
item.description: The Eiffel Tower was evacuated due to a shirtless man climbing the tower before the Paris Olympics closing ceremony. The man was seen above the first viewing deck, near the Olympic rings. French authorities deployed over 30,000 police officers in Paris, with significant security around the Stade de France. The closing ceremony is scheduled at Stade de France at 9pm.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan calls for religious 'tolerance' on Minorities' Day
item.description: On Minorities' Day, Pakistan's president emphasized promoting interfaith harmony, with recognition of minorities' contributions to nation-building. This came amid violence against minorities in Bangladesh, where Hindu homes and businesses were attacked. Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus condemned the incidents, urging protection for affected families. India continues engaging with Bangladesh's interim government over the issue.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Pakistani man shoots sister dead after she failed Class 9 exams
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Clearing out emotional baggage': How China’s sleepmakers are helping the '996' generation
item.description: A new profession in China, known as sleepmakers, has emerged to help individuals deal with sleep deprivation caused by stress. Sleepmakers provide emotional support and engaging conversations to aid sleep. They operate online and offline, earning up to 260 yuan per hour. Clients, mainly young adults, find relief in discussing their problems. Popular sleepmaker Sevenseven7 uses imaginative bedtime stories to attract audiences.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris endorses tax cut for tips, Donald Trump accuses her of 'copying his policy'
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris pledged to fight for working families by eliminating taxes on tips, a stance aligning with Donald Trump's earlier proposal. Campaigning with Minnesota Governor Tim Walz in swing states, Harris leads Trump in polls within key battlegrounds. Her recent Nevada visit and subsequent fundraiser in California highlighted her campaign efforts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Not born in the year of the dog? You're hired: China's zodiac job quirks
item.description: Sanxing Transportation in Guangdong, China, drew attention for its job listing, which excluded applicants born in the Year of the Dog. The company believed employees with this zodiac sign would clash with their dragon-born boss. Social media users criticized the practice as discriminatory, though a lawyer highlighted that such superstitions are not currently illegal.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry, Meghan Markle face tension as Duke is 'bored' with new life in US: Report
item.description: Prince Harry, residing in the United States since 2020, reportedly faced boredom and missed his old friends in the UK. Royal expert Tom Quinn mentioned that Harry's lack of day-to-day activities has created tension with Meghan Markle, who is busy with her projects. Harry misses the UK, adding to his unease.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Philippines' Marcos condemns China's 'illegal and reckless' actions over disputed reef
item.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos condemned 'illegal and reckless' actions by China after Chinese aircraft dropped flares near a Filipino military plane patrolling Scarborough Shoal. The incident, which endangered the crew, occurred during a routine Philippine Air Force operation. China claimed it acted lawfully to drive away the aircraft from its claimed territory.

item.title: Thousands protest in Serbia against revival of controversial Lithium mining project
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: War-torn Gaza faces rising child health threats: Hepatitis and skin diseases surge amid water crisis
item.description: In Gaza, children faced severe health issues, including hepatitis and skin ailments, due to a lack of clean water. The ongoing conflict damaged essential infrastructure like desalination plants and water wells. Humanitarian efforts to restore clean water have been hindered, leading to increased disease cases. The UN reported restoring electricity to a desalination plant to aid people, but risks remain high.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: TikToker raises over $320,000 for 90-year-old man forced to pawn Jewellery to take care of his wife
item.description: A TikToker raised over $320,000 for a 90-year-old Air Force veteran, Donald, who was selling his jewelry to pay overdue rent and avoid eviction with his wife suffering from dementia. TikToker Jenelle Marie first handed him $1,200, helping him settle his debt and keep his jewelry. She is now assisting them in finding stable housing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
